138        Silver(0xC0, 0xC0, 0xC0),
139        SkyBlue(0x87, 0xCE, 0xEB),
140        SlateBlue(0x6A, 0x5A, 0xCD),
141        SlateGray(0x70, 0x80, 0x90),
142        Snow(0xFF, 0xFA, 0xFA),
143        SpringGreen(0x00, 0xFF, 0x7F),
144        SteelBlue(0x46, 0x82, 0xB4),
145        Tan(0xD2, 0xB4, 0x8C),
146        Teal(0x00, 0x80, 0x80),
147        Thistle(0xD8, 0xBF, 0xD8),
148        Tomato(0xFF, 0x63, 0x47),
149        Turquoise(0x40, 0xE0, 0xD0),
150        Violet(0xEE, 0x82, 0xEE),
151        Wheat(0xF5, 0xDE, 0xB3),
152        White(0xFF, 0xFF, 0xFF),
153        WhiteSmoke(0xF5, 0xF5, 0xF5),
154        Yellow(0xFF, 0xFF, 0x00),
155        YellowGreen(0x9A, 0xCD, 0x32);
156        
157        private final int r, g, b;
158
159        CssColor(int r, int g, int b) {
160                this.r = r;
161                this.g = g;
162                this.b = b;
163        }
164
165        public int getRed() {
166                return r;
167        }
168
169        public int getGreen() {
170                return g;
171        }
172
173        public int getBlue() {
174                return b;
175        }
176
177        public Color toColor() {
178                return new Color(r, g, b);
179        }
180
181        public int getRGB() {
182                return toColor().getRGB();
183        }
184
185        public String getRGBString() {
186                /*
187                 * toHexString will return "0" instead of "00" String.format will not
188                 * 0-pad Strings or Hex Have to do it manually...
189                 */
190                return String.format("#%s%s%s",
191                                (r < 0x10 ? "0" : "") + Integer.toHexString(r), (g < 0x10 ? "0"
192                                                : "") + Integer.toHexString(g), (b < 0x10 ? "0" : "")
193                                                + Integer.toHexString(b));
194        }
195        
196        // Added by wilbur:
197        public static Color[] getColors(CssColor ... wcols) {
198                Color[] rgbColors = new Color[wcols.length];
199                for (int i=0; i<wcols.length; i++) {
200                        rgbColors[i] = wcols[i].toColor();
201                }
202                return rgbColors;
203        }
204        
205        public static final Color[] PreferredColors =
206                        getColors(
207                                        MediumBlue,
208                                        Crimson,
209                                        MediumSeaGreen,
210                                        BlueViolet,
211                                        Tomato,
212                                        CornFlowerBlue,
213                                        DeepPink,
214                                        YellowGreen,
215                                        Magenta,
216                                        //OliveDrab,
217                                        
218                                        DarkCyan
219                                        );
220}
